column1: Verkhnyaya Pyshma (Russian: Ве́рхняя Пышма́) is a town in Sverdlovsk Oblast
column3: located 1 kilometer (0.62 mi) north of Yekaterinburg. Population: 59

column1: It was founded in 1660 as the village (selo) of Pyshminskoye
column2: which was named after the Pyshma River. A copper mine opened here in 1856. Town status was granted to it in 1946.Town development in 20th century is closely related to copper production. The factory called Uralelectromed developed here and in 1990s it became the main company of UMMC holding. The company Ural Locomotives is also located there
column3: it produces modern Russian locomotives and trains such as 2ES10 (the most powerful Russian locomotive) and Lastochka suburban EMU based on Siemens Desiro.

column5: Verkhnyaya Pyshma and twenty-four rural localities are incorporated as Verkhnyaya Pyshma Urban Okrug. The town of Sredneuralsk
column6: together with three other rural localities
column7: is incorporated separately as Sredneuralsk Urban Okrug.

column1: The coat of arms of the town is a griffin holding a gold mirror of Venus. The griffin is the guard of riches and also the symbol of strength of mind. The mirror of Venus represents copper
column2: which is mined in the region.
